chosen_solution: Discrete-event mesh benchmark leveraging Mininet-WiFi with parameterized topology and MeshMetrics aggregator
rationale: Reuses existing MeshPay nodes and transports, adds a focused MeshMetrics collector and a reproducible benchmark CLI to produce TPS, latency distribution, and throughput for figures. This minimizes risk and integrates natively with the codebase.

applied_changes.summary: New thread-safe MeshMetrics with TPS, latency percentiles, bytes counters, JSON/CSV export
Benchmark CLI with parameters for authorities/clients/range/duration/rate/transport and outputs JSON/CSV/latencies
Pytest validating percentiles, TPS, success rate, and exports

next_steps: Add CLI flag for mobility models and interference to emulate challenging RF
Add authority-side latency recording (peer-level) for cross-checking
Produce plotting notebook to draw CDF/ECDF and throughput vs. nodes
Wire benchmark into CI smoke with very small topology (authorities=2, clients=2, duration=2)
